source.a48e146b:
# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed # It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python # For example, here's several helpful packages to load import plotly.express as px import plotly.graph_objects as go import numpy as np import pandas as pd import seaborn as sns import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory # For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory import os for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'): for filename in filenames: print(os.path.join(dirname, filename)) # You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" # You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session #including modules #get data data = pd.read_csv('../input/nootropics-clean/Nootropics.csv') #correlate data corr = data.corr() #using matplotlib to define the size plt.figure(figsize=(8, 8)) #creating the heatmap with seaborn ax = sns.heatmap( corr, vmin=-1, vmax=1, center=0, cmap=sns.diverging_palette(20, 220, n=200), square=True ) ax.set_xticklabels( ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, horizontalalignment='right' ); # 3-D Graph - Sleep,Mood,Memory,Libido,Lifting start, end = 0, 100 fig = go.Figure(data=go.Scatter3d( x=data['SLEEP'][start:end], y=data['MOOD'][start:end], z=data['MEMORY'][start:end], text=data['Substance'][start:end], mode='markers', marker=dict( sizemode='diameter', sizeref=1, size=data['LIFTING'][start:end], color = data['LIBIDO'][start:end], colorscale = 'Viridis', colorbar_title = 'LIBIDO
', line_color='rgb(140, 140, 170)' ) )) fig.update_layout(height=600, width=600, title='3-D Graph - X-Sleep,Y-Mood,Z-Memory,Size-Lifting,Color-Libido') fig.show() # 3-D Graph - FOCUS CREATIVITY CONFIDENCE LIFTING LEARNING start, end = 0, 100 fig = go.Figure(data=go.Scatter3d( x=data['SOCIAL'][start:end], y=data['CREATIVITY'][start:end], z=data['FOCUS'][start:end], text=data['Substance'][start:end], mode='markers', marker=dict( sizemode='diameter', sizeref=1, size=data['LIFTING'][start:end], color = data['LEARNING'][start:end], colorscale = 'Viridis', colorbar_title = 'LEARNING
', line_color='rgb(140, 140, 170)' ) )) fig.update_layout(height=600, width=600, title='3-D Graph - X-Social,Y-Creativity,Z-Focus,Size-Lifting,Color-Learning') fig.show() # 3-D Graph - MOTIVATION ENERGY ANTI-Aging ALERTNESS start, end = 0, 100 fig = go.Figure(data=go.Scatter3d( x=data['MOTIVATION'][start:end], y=data['ENERGY'][start:end], z=data['ANTI-AGING'][start:end], text=data['Substance'][start:end], mode='markers', marker=dict( sizemode='diameter', sizeref=1, size=data['LIFTING'][start:end], color = data['ALERTNESS'][start:end], colorscale = 'Viridis', colorbar_title = 'ALERTNESS
', line_color='rgb(140, 140, 170)' ) )) fig.update_layout(height=600, width=600, title='3-D Graph - X-MOTIVATION,Y-ENERGY,Z-ANTI-AGING,Size-Lifting,Color-Alertnes') fig.show() # 3-D Graph - MOTIVATION ENERGY ANTI-STRESS ANTI-AGING start, end = 0, 100 fig = go.Figure(data=go.Scatter3d( x=data['MOTIVATION'][start:end], y=data['ENERGY'][start:end], z=data['ANTI-AGING'][start:end], text=data['Substance'][start:end], mode='markers', marker=dict( sizemode='diameter', sizeref=1, size=data['LIFTING'][start:end], color = data['ANTI-STRESS'][start:end], colorscale = 'Viridis', colorbar_title = 'ANTI-Stress
', line_color='rgb(140, 140, 170)' ) )) fig.update_layout(height=600, width=600, title='3-D Graph - X-MOTIVATION,Y-ENERGY,Z-ANTI-AGING,Size-Lifting,Color-ANTI-Stress') fig.show() # Show Data data.describe() # Contrasting heatmap with seaborn sns.set_theme(style="dark") # Compute the correlation matrix corr = data.corr() # Generate a mask for the upper triangle mask = np.triu(np.ones_like(corr, dtype=bool)) # Set up the matplotlib figure f, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8)) # Generate a custom diverging colormap cmap = sns.diverging_palette(230, 20, as_cmap=True) # Draw the heatmap with the mask and correct aspect ratio sns.heatmap(corr, mask=mask, cmap=cmap, vmin=-0.1, vmax=0.1, center=0, square=True, linewidths=.5, cbar_kws={"shrink": .5})

source.10a25c42:
# Nootropics - Which Smart Drugs Help Us ?

Nootropics (/noʊ.əˈtrɒpɪks/ noh-ə-TROP-iks) (colloquial: smart drugs and cognitive enhancers) are drugs, supplements, and other substances that are claimed to improve cognitive function, particularly executive functions, memory, creativity, or motivation, in healthy individuals.[1] While many substances are purported to improve cognition, research is at a preliminary stage as of 2021, and the effects of the majority of these agents are not fully determined. In this analysis we gonna study them in detail.The term "nootropic" is derived from the Ancient Greek words νόος (nóos) meaning "mind" and τροπή (tropḗ) meaning "a turning".
